page.title: 16Housing in Priors Marston
page.content: Priors Marston was designated a {Conservation Area}in{1970}in an attempt to control development & preserve its character & open spaces, but extensive in-filling has since occured &{30}houses have been built. Applicants for{planning permission are entitled to that permission unless deemed detrimental to the existing village scene. This is entirely subjective & often controversial. Successive Parish Councils & local residents have protested strongly against a number of decisions. This is a popular{retirement {village,}and the high percentage of over-60s keeps house prices high. {Cheaper housing}for{younger people is needed, but unless national/county policy is changed to allow development outside the village boundaries, the future of our{school}remains in doubt.
